meanings.sent1: The room was lit up by the bright sun shining through the window.
meanings.sent2: The lit candle cast a warm glow in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The lit lantern made the ghost story seem less scary.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the entire room like a beacon of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The lit fireworks painted the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.sent1: After too many drinks, he stumbled around looking completely lit.
meanings.sent2: She regretted the embarrassing things she did while being lit at the party.
meanings.sent3: The lit guy tried to dance on the table but ended up falling.
meanings.sent4: His lit behavior at the bar was a clear sign he had too much to drink.
meanings.sent5: The lit group of friends laughed loudly, drawing attention to their intoxicated state.

meanings.sent1: The concert was so lit that everyone was dancing and singing along.
meanings.sent2: The party was a lit event with great music and fun activities.
meanings.sent3: The lit movie had everyone on the edge of their seats with suspense.
meanings.sent4: The lit roller coaster ride left them exhilarated and thrilled.
meanings.sent5: The lit atmosphere of the festival filled everyone with joy and excitement.
